qas.question: What is Nigeria's most popular organized-crime activity?
What drug does Nigeria ship from Asia to Europe and America?
What drug does Nigeria ship from South America to Europe and South Africa?
How many civilians were killed in Lagos in Aug 2000-May 2001?
How many police were killed in Lagos in Aug 2000-May 2001?

context: Nigeria is home to a substantial network of organised crime, active especially in <a0_0>drug trafficking<a0_0/>. Nigerian criminal groups are heavily involved in drug trafficking, shipping <a1_0>heroin<a1_0/> from Asian countries to Europe and America; and <a2_0>cocaine<a2_0/> from South America to Europe and South Africa. . The various Nigerian Confraternities or "campus cults" are active in both organised crime and in political violence as well as providing a network of corruption within Nigeria. As confraternities have extensive connections with political and military figures, they offer excellent alumni networking opportunities. The Supreme Vikings Confraternity, for example, boasts that twelve members of the Rivers State House of Assembly are cult members. On lower levels of society, there are the "area boys", organised gangs mostly active in Lagos who specialise in mugging and small-scale drug dealing. According to official statistics, gang violence in Lagos resulted in <a3_0>273<a3_0/> civilians and <a4_0>84<a4_0/> policemen killed in the period of August 2000 to May 2001.
